channel.title: defjaf tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from defjaf.

item.description: @alirahimi0 @cosmic_mar Generally, there is some likelihood function which will give any posterior at all (at least for proper priors with finite range), and hence there is no necessary relation at all between prior & posterior entropy. (Gaussians are special: the posterior width always increases.)
@DanielWhiteson ‚ÄúI am sitting at a desk, typing on a computer, and seeing words on the screen in front of me‚Äù is very emergent, and very true.

The first IRL-exam I‚Äôve given in three years! Good luck to our great @ImperialPhysics students. https://t.co/66VNdWRL4z
https://t.co/aYDqSoddv3
@ulyssesapp I‚Äôve got Ulysses on several devices, and all of a sudden it is consistently freezing on launch on one of my Macs. Help, please!
I am honestly unsure whether the email ‚ÄúWelcome to the ua-internal-reseacrher [sic] Group‚Äù is legit. Do any of my @ImperialCollege colleagues know?
I am honestly unsure whether the email ‚ÄúWelcome to the ua-internal-reseacrher [sic] Group‚Äù is legit. Do any of my https://t.co/iUcU4fjkLc colleagues know?

@daringfireball In fact, NFC payments were pretty common in the UK and EU prior to Apple Pay‚Ä¶ The claim that ‚ÄúNFC payments were used by almost no one‚Äù is US-centric and/or disingenuous, and specifically not relevant to the EU where this report originates.
@daringfireball (To be clear, the payments in the UK and EU are mostly from cards, not mobile phones, and I am pretty sure the 2017 90% number refers to phone-based transactions.)
@cosmonist @AlanHeavens üòú Although you‚Äôre missing a lone P(E) factor on the RHS!‚Ä¶
